greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Inverse Moebius transform of A061142.
comment: If s is squarefree then a(s) = A048691(s).

More generally: Let a_q(n) be multiplicative with a_q(p^e) = (q^(e+1)-1)/ (q-1) for prime p, e >= 0 and some fixed integer q. Then a_q(n) is the inverse Moebius transform of the completely multiplicative sequence b_q(n) = q^bigomega(n) with b_q(p) = q and b_q(1) = 1. For q = 1 see a_q(n) = A000005(n) and b_q(n) = A000012(n), for q = 0 see a_q(n) = A000012(n) and b_q(n) = A000007(n) with offset 1, and for q = -1 see a_q(n) = A010052(n) with offset 1 and b_q(n) = A008836(n). - _Werner Schulte_, Feb 20 2019
link: Enrique Pérez Herrero, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
results.author: _Enrique Pérez Herrero_, Apr 14 2012
